intro: Pedicularis alatavica, commonly known as the winged lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred petals and distinctive wing-like structures on its leaves. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
